summaryOfNewsArticle: The Ministry of Digital Affairs has introduced a comprehensive data privacy policy effective from April 1, 2024, aiming to enhance the security and transparency of personal data handling across all government digital services. The policy mandates explicit consent for data collection and establishes a new Data Protection Authority to oversee compliance. Initial implementation is scheduled for a four-month pilot phase, followed by full rollout by the end of 2024. Public response has been largely positive, reflecting growing trust in the government's commitment to privacy and transparency.
title: New Government Data Privacy Policy Set to Launch April 1, 2024
